(Top) TNPACB employees taking out a rally in Palayamkottai on Monday.(Above) Agitation in Thoothukudi— Photos: A. Shaikmohideen and N. Rajesh

(Top) TNPACB employees taking out a rally in Palayamkottai on Monday.(Above) Agitation in Thoothukudi— Photos: A. Shaikmohideen and N. Rajesh

Demanding pension for ration shop workers and employees of cooperative banks, members of Tamil Nadu Primary Agriculture Cooperative Bank Employees Association took out a rally at Palayamkottai on Monday.

The processionists said the employees of primary agriculture cooperative banks and the ration shops should be given pension and those who had retired from service given ex-gratia pension on compassionate grounds.

After taking out the rally from Jawahar Grounds in Palayamkottai, the processionists reached the Office of Joint Registrar of Cooperative Societies near Loyola Convent, Palayamkottai.

Vice-president of Confederation of All India Government Officials’ Association R. Seetharaman flagged off the rally in which office-bearers of the Association K. Muthupandian, M. Subramanian, L. Paulraj and others participated.

Thoothukudi

Tamil Nadu Primary Agriculture Cooperative Bank Employees Association members staged a demonstration.

M. Jesurajan, district secretary, spoke.
title: Stir by ration shop workers, coop. bank staff
